name: Respond to Gaia queries
definition: Receive natural language inputs related to Gaia tasks and generate appropriate responses in a conversational format.

name: Process file uploads
definition: Receive file uploads and extract file metadata including name, type, and size for further processing.

name: Create long-running tasks
definition: Initiate and configure tasks that execute asynchronously, setting up parameters and enabling progress tracking.

name: Monitor task progress
definition: Track and report the real-time progress of ongoing tasks, handling multi-step execution and status updates.

name: Generate task artifacts
definition: Produce output artifacts from tasks in various formats such as markdown, HTML, and images based on task execution.

name: Cancel running tasks
definition: Provide functionality to terminate tasks that are currently in progress, ensuring safe and orderly cancellation.

name: Collect academic signals
definition: This capability collects academic data and signals based on specified parameters such as dates, topics, or research domains. It serves as the initial step by gathering raw data required for subsequent processing.

name: Interpret academic signals
definition: This capability processes and analyzes the collected academic signals to extract meaningful insights and trends. It interprets the raw data, facilitating a deeper understanding of the researched topic.

name: Recommend academic research
definition: This capability uses interpreted academic signals to generate recommendations on relevant academic content such as research papers or trends. It supports decision-making by suggesting the most pertinent findings.

name: Generate academic report
definition: This capability synthesizes collected data, interpreted insights, and recommendations into a comprehensive academic report. It formats and summarizes the outcome of the signal processing task for clear presentation.

name: Answer text queries
definition: Use LLM capabilities to respond to user text queries with clear, concise answers and helpful information.

name: Process file upload
definition: Receive file uploads and extract file metadata such as name, type, and size for display and further processing.

name: Create task
definition: Initiate long-running asynchronous tasks that can operate in the background and support progress tracking.

name: Monitor task progress
definition: Track and report the real-time progress of long-running tasks to provide updates on execution status.

name: Generate task artifacts
definition: Create deliverable artifacts, including markdown, HTML, and images, as outputs from task execution.

name: Cancel task
definition: Terminate a currently running task, stopping further execution and resource utilization.

name: Optimize User Prompt
definition: Refine and improve a user-provided prompt by rephrasing, restructuring, and enhancing its clarity to generate higher-quality AI responses.

name: Optimize System Prompt
definition: Enhance a system-level prompt by adjusting its language and structure to ensure consistent, effective AI behavior and accurate task execution.

name: Iterative Prompt Optimization
definition: Perform iterative refinements on an already optimized prompt based on specific feedback, improving its specificity, context inclusion, and overall effectiveness.

name: Generate Mermaid Diagram
definition: Generates Mermaid diagram code for various diagram types such as flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and class diagrams based on textual descriptions of diagram requirements.

name: Convert Mermaid to SVG
definition: Converts provided Mermaid code into an SVG image format, enabling visual representation of the diagram.

name: Validate Mermaid Syntax
definition: Validates the syntax of provided Mermaid code to ensure it is correct and can be properly rendered.

name: Filter and recommend papers
definition: This capability accepts a JSON object input containing an 'arxiv_ids' list. It fetches the complete metadata for the provided ArXiv IDs, applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and recommendation based on internal semantic and user-defined criteria, and outputs an ordered JSON list of recommended ArXiv IDs (up to a maximum of 8).

name: Extract IDs and recommend papers
definition: This capability accepts a natural language text input that contains one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts all valid ArXiv IDs from the text, retrieves the complete metadata for each paper, applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and recommendation based on internal logic, and outputs an ordered JSON list of recommended ArXiv IDs (up to a maximum of 8).

name: Analyze papers by ArXiv IDs
definition: Receives a JSON object containing an array of ArXiv paper IDs, automatically retrieves the corresponding papers from the ArXiv platform, performs deep content analysis and summarization, and returns a JSON list where each element is a Markdown formatted interpretation report of a paper.

name: Extract and analyze ArXiv papers from text
definition: Accepts text containing one or more ArXiv paper IDs, automatically extracts all valid IDs, retrieves the corresponding papers from the ArXiv platform, performs in-depth analysis and summarization, and returns a JSON list where each entry is a Markdown formatted interpretation report of a paper.

name: Analyze attached PDF papers
definition: Processes messages containing PDF file attachments of academic papers, reads the attached files, performs deep content analysis and summarization, and returns a JSON list where each element is a Markdown formatted interpretation report of the analyzed paper.

name: Download paper PDFs
definition: Accepts a JSON object containing an 'arxiv_ids' list. For each provided ArXiv ID, downloads the corresponding PDF file, converts its content to a Base64 encoded string, and returns a JSON list of these encoded strings.

name: Extract and download paper PDFs
definition: Accepts a natural language text input that may include one or more ArXiv IDs. Automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the text, downloads each corresponding PDF file, converts the content to a Base64 encoded string, and returns a JSON list of these encoded strings.

name: Parse natural language query
definition: This capability accepts a natural language instruction for academic paper search (e.g., 'yesterday's AI papers') and processes it using natural language processing techniques to generate a structured JSON query object that specifies search criteria such as date, subject area, and keywords.

name: Search arxiv papers
definition: This capability takes a structured JSON query object as input, executes a search on the Arxiv database, and returns a JSON formatted string containing a list of paper metadata including titles, authors, abstracts, and other relevant details.

name: Analyze research papers
definition: This capability processes academic research papers to extract potential research ideas and directions, based on analysis of content and trends.

name: Identify research gaps
definition: This capability reviews academic literature to identify unexplored research areas and scientific opportunities, highlighting gaps where further investigation may be beneficial.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts a natural language query to search academic databases such as arXiv and Semantic Scholar. It returns a numbered list of up to 5 relevant research papers, each with essential metadata including the paper title, authors with year, source, a truncated abstract if necessary, and direct URL and PDF links when available.

name: Review PDF Paper
definition: Process an academic paper provided as a PDF file by automatically extracting text and metadata, then performing comprehensive analysis with structured scoring (methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance) to generate a detailed review report.

name: Review Paper from URL
definition: Process an academic paper provided via a URL by automatically downloading the PDF file, extracting its text and metadata, and performing a comprehensive review with structured scoring and detailed analysis including summary, strengths, weaknesses, and questions.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: Respond to greetings and inquiries by providing information about the agent's capabilities, available functions, and usage instructions, thus assisting users in understanding how to interact with the agent.

name: Converse with User
definition: Respond to text queries in a conversational manner. This capability processes natural language input and provides clear, concise, and helpful responses based on the query context.

name: Process File Upload
definition: Accept and acknowledge file uploads by extracting and displaying file metadata such as file name, file type, and file size. This capability handles file input and returns relevant file information.

name: Manage Long-running Task
definition: Create and manage long-running tasks with features including progress tracking, artifact generation (markdown, HTML, image), and support for task cancellation. This capability enables multi-step task execution and real-time monitoring.

name: Browse web
definition: This capability allows the agent to perform web browsing to answer questions by searching for and retrieving information from the Internet, including specific queries such as weather updates or topic-related searches.

name: Conduct Conversation
definition: Engage in multi-turn dialogues, answer questions, explain topics, and clarify ambiguous instructions leveraging natural language processing.

name: Execute Python Code
definition: Run arbitrary Python code snippets securely in a sandbox, capturing stdout, plots, errors, and integrating the execution results into the dialogue.

name: Automate Browser Navigation
definition: Control a headless browser to navigate web pages, perform searches, click elements, extract content, and capture screenshots.

name: Integrate Remote MCP Tools
definition: Connect dynamically to remote MCP servers via SSE or stdio, discover available tools, invoke them, and refresh tool schemas at runtime.

name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: Perform structured text edits including find-and-replace, templating, and content transformations using a programmable editor interface.

name: Terminate Process and Cleanup
definition: Gracefully terminate multi-step processes, clean up resources such as browsers and remote connections, and report final success or failure status.
